meanings.sent1: She carefully upbinding the books with a ribbon.
meanings.sent2: He always upbinding his shoelaces before going for a run.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried upbinding its tail with a piece of yarn.
meanings.sent4: The magician upbinding the audience's attention with his mesmerizing tricks.
meanings.sent5: The spider skillfully upbinding its prey in silk threads.

meanings.definition: The act of binding or tying up.
meanings.sent1: The upbinding of the packages was done efficiently.
meanings.sent2: She observed the upbinding of the papers with interest.
meanings.sent3: The upbinding of the balloons made them look like colorful bunches of grapes.
meanings.sent4: The upbinding of the contract sealed the deal between the two companies.
meanings.sent5: The upbinding of the vines along the fence added a rustic charm to the garden.
